New Orleans, 31st Dec, 1851.
M.M. Cohen, Esq.,
Chairman of Executive Committee.
Sir:
I have the honor to submit herewith, a Report of so much of the
Survey of the Route of the Railroad to Opelousas as the limited time 1 have Itad would
permit.
After having received the appointment as Chief of the Survey, I prepared to go to work at
once. But, as not only the importance of the work, but the unknown nature of the country
between Algiers and Thibodeauxville, required a reconrroisarrce before determining where the
wveys should pass, I proceeded frdm Algeirs to ThiodeauSville, in company with W. T.
Thompson, Esq., Assistant Engineer.
Our route was up the river to the Barrataria Canal; down the Canal through Lake Washa -
«P the Bayou des Allemands to Lake des Allemands ; through the Lake, down Bayou Brfiuf,'
miles, to its juncture with Bayou Cabanosa or Chegbee ; up Bayou Chegbee to Laforest's
cuddy's plantation, and from therice to Thibodeauxville. This route crossed the direct
to on the Bayou des Alleminds, passing south of it on the eastern portion, and north of it on
J western portion, leaving the other sides for a future reconnoisance. The result of our ob-
itions and inquiries was, that a line could be run in nearly a straight course between Al-
